laboratory_examinations.findings: White blood cell count was only 0.1 × 10^9/L initially, and later increased to 7.2 × 10^9/L by day 20 after transplantation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: White blood cell count increased from 0.1 × 10^9/L to 7.2 × 10^9/L over a period of 20 days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Complete engraftment observed with all cells corresponding to the female donor; no evidence of residual myeloma.
